channel.title: ::item command
channel.description: can any 1 post there ::item command cause i cant find it in ym commands.java but i can still do ::item just not admins how would i make it were admins can do ::item and ::master to

[quote=“Untrimmed, post:10, topic:416815”][quote author=soldierslim2 link=topic=518756.msg3770239#msg3770239 date=1317599431]

You need to put your ::item command under this:

You also don’t need the

[/quote] well they were on the public void ownercommands let em try put them under administratorcommands

Keep the command in ownercommands too, otherwise you wont be able to use the command.[/quote] it worked tysm

item.title: ::item command
item.dc:creator: @Saletana Saletana
item.description:
@Saletana wrote:

Honestly, this is crap. An item command is different on most likely every different source. If someone sends you his item command, mabye your server has not added the int’s of the command that the one that you have been sent requires.
That’s why you should not ask for complete commands here. Better ask for explenations.

If the command works, then you are probably lucky.

Read full topic

item.title: ::item command
item.dc:creator: @reward reward
item.description:
@reward wrote:

[PI] Item Command (Change c.playerRights == 2 to whatever your admin rights are)

[code]if (playerCommand.startsWith(“item”) && c.playerRights == 2) {
try {
String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
c.sendMessage(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
c.sendMessage(“Use as ::item 995 1”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {

			}
		}[/code]

Read full topic
